no floppy drive on the laptop: - the linux "dd" command and a "boot.lnx" file can be helpful.

- I have had bad luck with dual booting from one disk. the windows installer doesn't respect established partitions. windows needs frequent re-installs so i use two disks one for linux and another for windows and use the bios to switch between them by changing the boot priority. (wish this worked in laptops no room for a second disk)
- often you can call tech no-support for a CD. HP amd Gateway are free.
